    Celerity in the `lorentz` package

Photons

photon.Rd

Various functionality to deal with the 4-momentum of a photon

Usage

is.consistent.nullvec(N,TOL=1e-10)
as.photon(x,E=1)

Arguments

N

Four-momentum to be tested for nullness

TOL

tolerance

x

Vector of three-velocities

E

Energy, a scalar

Details

Returns the four-momentum of a photon.

Author

Robin K. S. Hankin

See also

4mom,reflect

Examples


## A bunch of photons all approximately parallel to the x-axis:
as.photon(as.3vel(cbind(0.9,runif(10)/1000,runif(10)/1000)))
#>       E       p_x          p_y          p_z
#>  [1,] 1 0.9999999 2.699996e-04 3.980076e-04
#>  [2,] 1 0.9999999 4.743381e-04 2.029622e-04
#>  [3,] 1 0.9999998 5.022332e-04 2.407529e-04
#>  [4,] 1 0.9999995 9.988059e-04 3.008704e-04
#>  [5,] 1 0.9999999 1.208259e-04 3.355391e-04
#>  [6,] 1 0.9999994 1.058862e-03 4.612299e-05
#>  [7,] 1 0.9999992 1.010698e-03 7.169422e-04
#>  [8,] 1 0.9999992 6.792320e-04 1.052474e-03
#>  [9,] 1 0.9999997 4.470981e-05 8.146753e-04

## mirror ball:
jj <- matrix(rnorm(30),10,3)
disco <- sweep(matrix(rnorm(30),10,3),1,sqrt(rowSums(jj^2)),`/`)
p <- as.photon(c(1,0,0))
reflect(p,disco)
#>   E          p_x         p_y         p_z
#> x 1 -0.005427304 -0.57641788  0.81713706
#> x 1  0.806800139 -0.02796765  0.59016214
#> x 1  0.126572208 -0.99103962 -0.04266087
#> x 1  0.691612265 -0.60953210 -0.38748303
#> x 1 -0.689056234  0.70898801 -0.15012496
#> x 1  0.912043824 -0.26865182  0.30984231
#> x 1  0.675572049  0.06095105  0.73477029
#> x 1 -0.805854734  0.19651994 -0.55854996
#> x 1  0.568124925 -0.02041134  0.82268916
#> x 1 -0.015906945 -0.18533727 -0.98254622

table(reflect(p,disco)[,2]>0) # should be TRUE with probability sqrt(0.5)
#> 
#> FALSE  TRUE 
#>     4     6 

## relativistic  disco; mirror ball moves at 0.5c:

B <- boost(as.3vel(c(0.5,0,0)))
p |> tcrossprod(B) |> reflect(disco) |> tcrossprod(solve(B))
#>           t          x           y           z
#> x 0.6648576  0.3297151 -0.33279502  0.47177430
